feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 12:41PM AKST until February 08 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility to one half mile or less occurring. * WHERE...Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills. * WHEN...Until 9 PM today.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 12:41PM AKST until February 09 at 7:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and wind chills to 50 below zero occuring. Visibility will be on half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 11:34AM AKST until February 08 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches. Winds gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Klondike Highway above 2000 feet. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST Tuesday.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued February 08 at 4:17AM AKST until February 09 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range mainly through Isabel Pass. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 AM AKST Wednesday.

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 08 at 4:12AM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 65 below occuring, and blowing snow with reduced visibility to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Near Passes of the Southeastern Brooks Range.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 4:12AM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Cold wind chills to 40 to 50 below zero occurring, with blowing snow to one half mile or less at times. Plan on difficult travel conditions. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits and near Indian Mountain.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 4:12AM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero are occurring. Blowing snow will cause reduced visibilities to one half mile or less along highway summits. Plan on difficult travel conditions.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 4:12AM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. * WHERE...Elliott Highway Summits.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 08 at 4:09AM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 50 below zero to 59 below zero.

entry.title: Extreme Fire Danger issued February 08 at 2:32PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...extreme fire danger today... The rangeland fire danger index will be in the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme fire danger means that fires start quickly...spread furiously and burn intensely. All fires are potentially serious. All outdoor burning should be avoided in areas with extreme fire

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 9:56AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: Elevated to strong winds are expected to ramp up across the NE panhandle. The winds will begin to increase this morning and continue through much of the afternoon. Expect winds 30-35 mph, with gusts up too 45 mph. Dry fuels, combined with gusty winds and low RH values will create elevated to near critical fire weather conditions this afternoon.
